thread.title: Indian fisherman shot dead by Sri Lankan Navy; protests break out in Rameshwaram
thread.title_full: Indian fisherman shot dead by Sri Lankan Navy; protests break out in Rameshwaram

author: FE Online
title: Indian fisherman shot dead by Sri Lankan Navy; protests break out in Rameshwaram
text:
Indian fisherman shot dead by Sri Lankan Navy; protests break out in Rameshwaram Indian fisherman shot dead by Sri Lankan Navy; protests break out in Rameshwaram People are protesting against the killing of the Indian fisherman by the Srilankan Navy in Rameswaram. By: FE Online | New Delhi  28 PM Thamizhaga Vazhvurimai Katchi party workers. (ANI) 
People are protesting against the killing of the Indian fisherman by the Srilankan Navy in Rameswaram. Thamizhaga Vazhvurimai Katchi party workers climbed towers as a sign of protest, people have gathered around in villages and want the government to take quick steps. On March 6, a group of Indian fishermen, who were fishing between Danushkodi and Katchatheevu off the Tamil Nadu coast, were allegedly fired upon by the Sri Lankan Navy in which one fisherman was killed on March 6. The deceased was identified as a 22-year-old man and his body was brought to the Rameshwaram Government Hospital. Meanwhile, a case had been registered in the local police station. According to reports, around 3 more fishermen have suffered injuries in the firing which occurred in Adambalam, that comes under Indian territory. (ANI) 
DMK Leader M K Stalin has critised the Narendra Modi -led central government and has asked them to take a strong step towards the killing of the Indian fisherman by the Sri Lankan Navy on March 6. Stalin said, “High time Central Government reacts strongly to this problem, can’t be a mute spectator.” According to sources, ‘The government is deeply concerned at the killing of an Indian fisherman. The High Commissioner of Sri Lanka has taken up matter with Sri Lankan PM.’ Protests are taking place against the killing of the Indian fisherman, Thamizhaga Vazhvurimai Katchi party workers climb tower as a sign of protest in Rameshwaram. 
Further details awaited.
